content.raw: Putting this into a list is unnecessary. You should do this within the NumPy array.
content.html: Putting this into a list is unnecessary. You should do this within the NumPy array.

content.raw: `output_seg` is not a good name for this. Why not `output_label`?
content.html: output_seg is not a good name for this. Why not output_label?

content.raw: This needs a comment saying what `output_seg` values are expected.
content.html: This needs a comment saying what output_seg values are expected.

content.raw:
I was trying to figure that out too then I realized I made the mistake and ran your test suite without your version of segway (whatever was on my path).

I can confirm that everything is passing on my end with your version of segway.
content.html:

content.raw:
Hm, gmtkPrint gives me the same output. The only files that do not match are the log files which say what arguments are being passed, which I thought I had  changed correctly to account for the new command line option (that's what the changes to the files in the touchstone directories are). In test/simpleconcat/test-*/traindir/train.tab, and the corresponding touchstone file, is there a line under the num_subsegs line which says:

```
output_seg     seg
```

so 

```
num_segs        4
num_subsegs     1
output_seg      seg
params_filename traindir/params/params.params
```

is that area of the file? The changes to the test/ directory add that line to the touchstone file, and the changes to run.py should add that line to the test's output file.

In test/simpleconcat/test-*/traindir/train.tab, and the corresponding touchstone file, is there a line under the num_subsegs line which says:

output_seg     seg

so 

num_segs        4
num_subsegs     1
output_seg      seg
params_filename traindir/params/params.params

is that area of the file? The changes to the test/ directory add that line to the touchstone file, and the changes to run.py should add that line to the test's output file.

content.raw: @ericr86 Also Eric, I meant to ask, could you recheck the pull request? On my end it's passing the tests now.

update.description:
Based on a user option, --output-label, the bed file will output either the superlabel only (default), the sublabel only, or both concatenated with a period. The tests produce the same result for me with and without these changes.

Update 2014-06-20
This is only done with the viterbi task for now, posterior will output superlabels only, and raise error if trying to do posterior and also trying to print sublabels. touchstone files are updated as a result of output_seg argument being passed, and viterbi regex filter which catches subseg and seg lines. Tests working now.

content.raw:
OK sorry, I missed an error in the data/ test, because find_segment_starts is used for the posterior bed as well. Is it acceptable to have separate find_segment_starts functions for these two? The data passed to it in the viterbi function is now a 2D array in order to find differences in labels and sublabels.

If so I can close this and resubmit with those changes
content.html:
OK sorry, I missed an error in the data/ test, because find_segment_starts is used for the posterior bed as well. Is it acceptable to have separate find_segment_starts functions for these two? The data passed to it in the viterbi function is now a 2D array in order to find differences in labels and sublabels.

If so I can close this and resubmit with those changes
